meanings.definition: The act of defying or challenging authority or rules.
meanings.sent1: Her defiances against the strict teacher's rules often landed her in trouble.
meanings.sent2: The student's defiances of the school dress code resulted in detention.
meanings.sent3: The cat's defiance of the 'no pets allowed' sign at the park caused quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: The tree's defiance of gravity as it grew sideways fascinated the onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The child's defiance of bedtime was met with a stern warning from their parent.

meanings.definition: A refusal to obey or comply with something.
meanings.sent1: The worker's repeated defiances of safety protocols led to his dismissal.
meanings.sent2: The criminal's defiance of the law eventually caught up with him.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's defiance of eating vegetables turned dinner time into a battle.
meanings.sent4: The storm's defiance of the weather forecast took everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The student's defiance of the no-cellphone policy resulted in confiscation of the device.

meanings.sent1: The protestors showed their defiances by marching in the streets.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's defiance of the enemy's advance inspired his comrades.
meanings.sent3: The cat's defiance of the vacuum cleaner was both amusing and frustrating.
meanings.sent4: The mountain's defiance of erosion stood as a testament to its strength.
meanings.sent5: The team's defiance of the odds led them to victory against all expectations.
